info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 30 at 3:49PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Robeson County through 415 PM EDT... At 348 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lumberton, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Robeson Community College, Howellsville, Tolarsville, Barker Ten Mile, Hestertown, Smiths and Southeastern Regional Medical Center. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 12 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
